title: Electric force - spheres of charge -q q and 2q

content.question: Three small spheres with charges <math alttext="negative q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mi>q</mi></mpadded></math>, <math alttext="positive q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>q</mi></mpadded></math>, and <math alttext="positive 2 q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>q</mi></mpadded></math> are arranged in a line, as shown in the figure. What is the magnitude of the net electrostatic force exerted on the sphere of charge <math alttext="positive q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>q</mi></mpadded></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="Three halves times the fraction with numerator q squared, and denominator 4 pi epsilon sub 0, end sub, times d squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mfrac><msup><mi>q</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Five halves times the fraction with numerator q squared, and denominator 4 pi epsilon sub 0, end sub, times d squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>5</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mfrac><msup><mi>q</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Seven fourths times the fraction with numerator q squared, and denominator 4 pi epsilon sub 0, end sub, times d squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>7</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mfrac><msup><mi>q</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="nine fourths times the fraction with numerator q squared, and denominator 4 pi epsilon sub 0, end sub, times d squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>9</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mfrac><msup><mi>q</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="nine fourths times the fraction with numerator q squared, and denominator 4 pi epsilon sub 0, end sub, times d squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>9</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mfrac><msup><mi>q</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
